intro: Pteroglossa euphlebia, commonly known as the golden tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has finely divided, grass-like leaves and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
